trans-unit.source: What is Azure Machine Learning Studio? | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: What is Azure Machine Learning Studio? | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Overview of Azure ML Studio, a drag-and-drop tool for quickly building models from a ready-to-use library of algorithms and modules.
trans-unit.target: Overview of Azure ML Studio, a drag-and-drop tool for quickly building models from a ready-to-use library of algorithms and modules.

trans-unit.source: What is Azure Machine Learning Studio?
trans-unit.target: What is Azure Machine Learning Studio?

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Studio is a collaborative, drag-and-drop tool you can use to build, test, and deploy predictive analytics solutions on your data.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Studio is a collaborative, drag-and-drop tool you can use to build, test, and deploy predictive analytics solutions on your data.

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio publishes models as web services that can easily be consumed by custom apps or BI tools such as Excel.
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio publishes models as web services that can easily be consumed by custom apps or BI tools such as Excel.

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio - sometimes called "Azure ML Studio" - is where data science, predictive analytics, cloud resources, and your data meet.
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio - sometimes called "Azure ML Studio" - is where data science, predictive analytics, cloud resources, and your data meet.

trans-unit.source: The Machine Learning Studio interactive workspace
trans-unit.target: The Machine Learning Studio interactive workspace

trans-unit.source: To develop a predictive analysis model, you typically use data from one or more sources, transform and analyze that data through various data manipulation and statistical functions, and generate a set of results.
trans-unit.target: To develop a predictive analysis model, you typically use data from one or more sources, transform and analyze that data through various data manipulation and statistical functions, and generate a set of results.

trans-unit.source: Developing a model like this is an iterative process.
trans-unit.target: Developing a model like this is an iterative process.

trans-unit.source: As you modify the various functions and their parameters, your results converge until you are satisfied that you have a trained, effective model.
trans-unit.target: As you modify the various functions and their parameters, your results converge until you are satisfied that you have a trained, effective model.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Studio gives you an interactive, visual workspace to easily build, test, and iterate on a predictive analysis model.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Studio gives you an interactive, visual workspace to easily build, test, and iterate on a predictive analysis model.

trans-unit.source: You drag-and-drop *datasets* and analysis *modules* onto an interactive *canvas*, connecting them together to form an *experiment*, which you *run* in Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: You drag-and-drop *datasets* and analysis *modules* onto an interactive *canvas*, connecting them together to form an *experiment*, which you *run* in Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: To iterate on your model design, you *edit* the experiment, *save* a copy if desired, and run it again.
trans-unit.target: To iterate on your model design, you *edit* the experiment, *save* a copy if desired, and run it again.

trans-unit.source: When you're ready, you can *publish* your experiment as a *web service* so that your model can be accessed by others.
trans-unit.target: When you're ready, you can *publish* your experiment as a *web service* so that your model can be accessed by others.

trans-unit.source: There is no programming required, just visually connecting datasets and modules to construct your predictive analysis model.
trans-unit.target: There is no programming required, just visually connecting datasets and modules to construct your predictive analysis model.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure ML Studio diagram: Create experiments, read data for many sources, write scored data, write models.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure ML Studio diagram: Create experiments, read data for many sources, write scored data, write models.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Get started with Machine Learning Studio
trans-unit.target: Get started with Machine Learning Studio

trans-unit.source: When you first enter Machine Learning Studio, you see the following tabs on the left:
trans-unit.target: When you first enter Machine Learning Studio, you see the following tabs on the left:

trans-unit.source: Studio Home - A set of links to documentation and other resources.
trans-unit.target: Studio Home - A set of links to documentation and other resources.

trans-unit.source: EXPERIMENTS - Experiments that have been created, run, and saved as drafts.
trans-unit.target: EXPERIMENTS - Experiments that have been created, run, and saved as drafts.

trans-unit.source: WEB SERVICES - A list of experiments that you have published.
trans-unit.target: WEB SERVICES - A list of experiments that you have published.

trans-unit.source: SETTINGS - A collection of settings that you can use to configure your account and resources.
trans-unit.target: SETTINGS - A collection of settings that you can use to configure your account and resources.

trans-unit.source: When you are constructing an experiment, a working list of available datasets and modules is displayed to the left of the canvas.
trans-unit.target: When you are constructing an experiment, a working list of available datasets and modules is displayed to the left of the canvas.

trans-unit.source: That is the list of components you use to build your model.
trans-unit.target: That is the list of components you use to build your model.

trans-unit.source: Components of an experiment
trans-unit.target: Components of an experiment

trans-unit.source: An experiment consists of datasets that provide data to analytical modules, which you connect together to construct a predictive analysis model.
trans-unit.target: An experiment consists of datasets that provide data to analytical modules, which you connect together to construct a predictive analysis model.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, a valid experiment has these characteristics:
trans-unit.target: Specifically, a valid experiment has these characteristics:

trans-unit.source: The experiment has at least one dataset and one module.
trans-unit.target: The experiment has at least one dataset and one module.

trans-unit.source: Datasets may be connected only to modules.
trans-unit.target: Datasets may be connected only to modules.

trans-unit.source: Modules may be connected to either datasets or other modules.
trans-unit.target: Modules may be connected to either datasets or other modules.

trans-unit.source: All input ports for modules must have some connection to the data flow.
trans-unit.target: All input ports for modules must have some connection to the data flow.

trans-unit.source: All required parameters for a module must be set.
trans-unit.target: All required parameters for a module must be set.

trans-unit.source: For an example of creating a simple experiment, see <link><linkText>Create a simple experiment in Azure Machine Learning Studio</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For an example of creating a simple experiment, see <link><linkText>Create a simple experiment in Azure Machine Learning Studio</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For a more complete walkthrough of creating a predictive analytics solution, see <link><linkText>Develop a predictive solution with Azure Machine Learning</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For a more complete walkthrough of creating a predictive analytics solution, see <link><linkText>Develop a predictive solution with Azure Machine Learning</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Datasets
trans-unit.target: Datasets

trans-unit.source: A dataset is data that has been uploaded to Machine Learning Studio so that it can be used in the modeling process.
trans-unit.target: A dataset is data that has been uploaded to Machine Learning Studio so that it can be used in the modeling process.

trans-unit.source: A number of sample datasets are included with Machine Learning Studio for you to experiment with, and you can upload more datasets as you need them.
trans-unit.target: A number of sample datasets are included with Machine Learning Studio for you to experiment with, and you can upload more datasets as you need them.

trans-unit.source: Here are some examples of included datasets:
trans-unit.target: Here are some examples of included datasets:

trans-unit.source: MPG data for various automobiles - Miles per gallon (MPG) values for automobiles identified by number of cylinders, horsepower, etc.
trans-unit.target: MPG data for various automobiles - Miles per gallon (MPG) values for automobiles identified by number of cylinders, horsepower, etc.

trans-unit.source: Breast cancer data - Breast cancer diagnosis data.
trans-unit.target: Breast cancer data - Breast cancer diagnosis data.

trans-unit.source: Forest fires data - Forest fire sizes in northeast Portugal.
trans-unit.target: Forest fires data - Forest fire sizes in northeast Portugal.

trans-unit.source: As you build an experiment, the working list of datasets is available to the left of the canvas.
trans-unit.target: As you build an experiment, the working list of datasets is available to the left of the canvas.

trans-unit.source: Modules
trans-unit.target: Modules

trans-unit.source: A module is an algorithm that you can perform on your data.
trans-unit.target: A module is an algorithm that you can perform on your data.

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio has a number of modules ranging from data ingress functions to training, scoring, and validation processes.
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio has a number of modules ranging from data ingress functions to training, scoring, and validation processes.

trans-unit.source: Here are some examples of included modules:
trans-unit.target: Here are some examples of included modules:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Convert to ARFF[convert-to-arff]</linkText><title></title></link> - Converts a .NET serialized dataset to Attribute-Relation File Format (ARFF).
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Convert to ARFF[convert-to-arff]</linkText><title></title></link> - Converts a .NET serialized dataset to Attribute-Relation File Format (ARFF).

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Elementary Statistics[elementary-statistics]</linkText><title></title></link> - Calculates elementary statistics such as mean, standard deviation, etc.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Elementary Statistics[elementary-statistics]</linkText><title></title></link> - Calculates elementary statistics such as mean, standard deviation, etc.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Linear Regression[linear-regression]</linkText><title></title></link> - Creates an online gradient descent-based linear regression model.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Linear Regression[linear-regression]</linkText><title></title></link> - Creates an online gradient descent-based linear regression model.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Score Model[score-model]</linkText><title></title></link> - Scores a trained classification or regression model.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Score Model[score-model]</linkText><title></title></link> - Scores a trained classification or regression model.

trans-unit.source: As you build an experiment, the working list of modules is available to the left of the canvas.
trans-unit.target: As you build an experiment, the working list of modules is available to the left of the canvas.

trans-unit.source: A module may have a set of parameters that you can use to configure the module's internal algorithms.
trans-unit.target: A module may have a set of parameters that you can use to configure the module's internal algorithms.

trans-unit.source: When you select a module on the canvas, the module's parameters are displayed in the pane to the right of the canvas.
trans-unit.target: When you select a module on the canvas, the module's parameters are displayed in the pane to the right of the canvas.

trans-unit.source: You can modify the parameters in that pane to tune your model.
trans-unit.target: You can modify the parameters in that pane to tune your model.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
